title: Demi Moore looks to be in a colorful mood as she dons a bright red dress for lunch in Los Angeles
text:
Demi Moore cut a colorful figure in West Hollywood, California on Friday as she was seen wearing a long-sleeve dress that was covered in colorful designs.

After weeks of promoting her new memoir, Inside Out, Moore was seen heading to lunch at the San Vicente Bungalows to enjoy a casual lunch with friends.

The Ghost actress, 56, paired the look with golden slip on shoes that shone brightly in the Los Angeles sunshine.

Bright red! Demi Moore, 56, cut a colorful figure as she was seen heading to lunch at the San Vicente Bungalows in West Hollywood, California on Friday

Demi carried a small Gucci purse with her that had a cute heart-shaped character on it.

She wore her long brunette tresses down straight with a middle part, accessorizing with gold earrings and black shades.

The actress recently said that she likes to 'celebrate' her losses.

Demi thinks people learn a lot from their low points in life, so, as well as enjoying the good moments, everyone should be thankful for the things that go wrong because they make the highs seem even better.

Shine on: The Ghost actress paired the look with golden slip on shoes that shone brightly in the Los Angeles sunshine

Speaking at a private dinner in New York in honor of her new memoir, she told the audience: 'It's not the wins, but in our losses that we gain our depth and insights, and while it's great to celebrate the wins when they are there -- don't overlook them -- it's beautiful to equally celebrate the losses.'

'Without them, we don't have the pleasure of really experiencing our wins. And [the book] is definitely a win,' Demi added.

Among the guests at the event were Demi's daughters, Rumer and Tallulah Willis, who poked fun at the Ghost actress before she gave her speech.

Gucci Gucci Gucci: Moore carried a small Gucci purse with her that had a cute heart-shaped character on it

According to the New York Post newspaper's Page Six column, Tallulah, 25, said: 'Mommy, I'm so proud of you and everything you've done in the book.'

'Everyone is like, "It's a whole night of you," which is so humble ... You do it like a champ,' she added.

Rumer, 31, also recently praised Demi for being so candid in her book, which covers subjects including her failed marriage to Ashton Kutcher, being raped as a teenager, and her battle with substance abuse.

Like mother like daughter: Among the guests at the event were Demi's daughters, Rumer Willis, 31, and Tallulah Willis, 25, who poked fun at the Ghost actress before she gave her speech (posted on October 16 in New York)

'I think so many women have watched her, and just as her daughter, I've watched her, as this beacon of strength and this kind of leader,' she said.

'What I really respect about her is that she is never the victim in her stories. She takes accountability. She takes responsibility, and mind you, this is her perspective, her story, and she's the first one to say that. She's allowing herself to show everyone that you can go through some really difficult, hard things, and you can still be someone who is thriving and taking accountability and just being a strong survivor without being, "Oh, I survived this and this is who I am because of this story,"' Rumer added.

Demi shares three children with her ex-husband, Bruce Willis: Rumer, Tallulah and Scout, 28.
